transcript.speaker: Choose a format
transcript.dialogue: Regular Table Indented Condensed
WAITING

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (sitting in Space Ghost's chair, watching monitor; subtitles: LIVE FEED: MANTIS MATING SEASON) Oh, get a load of that one! She's sublime! Those twitchy eyes, those powerful forelimbs!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (sighs) Every seven years, it's the same thing. Mantis mating season.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Oh, wait, that one's even cuter! Lovely pincers!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Look, Zorak, the show's about to start. I've gotta switch the feed.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: No! Don't! I think I just spotted the girl of my dreams.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Which girl?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: That girl! (zooms in on monitor, to Marlo Thomas mantis look-alike)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (invisos in) Greetings, citizens! Oops! (invisos out; zipper sound) Ah, better. (invisos back in)

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Eh, it's gonna be one of those shows... I think instead, I'll watch the Lava Network. (switches monitor to molten lava scene) Oooooh!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (invisos to desk) Greetings! I'm Space Ghost, welcome to the show! Today's guests include...

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Uh, show's over! G'night! G'night everybody! (band starts playing closing theme)

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (still watching lava show) Mmmm, make sweet love to me... What? Closing credit music? Yikes! (throws switch, starts closing credits)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Wow, hold it! What is goin' on? Stop those credits! Moltar!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (stops closing credits) Sorry, SG, I... thought the show was over.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: It is.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Nonsense! I had just started.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: No, you finished.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I did?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Yes!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Uh, um... who was on the show?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: It's right here. (opens "TV Today" magazine and reads) "Tonight the interplanetary talk show host interviewed TV star Catherine Bach and singer-songwriter Matthew Sweet."

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (to himself) (Hmmm, I can't remember, did I do the show or not?) What did Catherine Bach have to say?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Oh, she told a very amusing anecdote about... a bowling trophy!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Is that right, Moltar?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Uh, I think so.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: And how about Matthew Sweet? What did he have to say?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (pause) Nothin'.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Nothing? I find that hard to believe.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Oh, wait, you're right! He did say something.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (with "tingle tingle tingle" voice in background) (Hmmm, my super-power senses are tingling. What are they trying to tell me? Is it time to switch mouth wash? Stock up on string cheese? Start wearing a derby.) I've got it! Zorak's lying! No more fibs! What's going on?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Aaaaggghh! Mating season on my planet started twenty minutes ago! I must go!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: To get butter and cheese?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: I feel... the urge!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Typical musician! Look, we have a show to do, and you can't leave 'til it's over.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: But...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Put a lid on it, Zorak, or whatever you do. You'll just have to wait fifteen minutes before you go spread your evil seed. Now, I want to talk to Catherine Bach and ask her about that bowling trophy. (screen lowers with Catherine on it)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (starts gibbering)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Greetings, Catherine, and welcome to the show.

transcript.speaker: Catherine Bach
transcript.dialogue: Thank you, Space Ghost.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Tell me, Catherine, do you have a bowling trophy?

transcript.speaker: Catherine Bach
transcript.dialogue: Yes I do.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (laughs)

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (laughs)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: That was a good anecdote.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (laughs)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: I'm getting splotchy.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: As we all know, you originated the role of Daisy on "The Dukes of Hazzard," and I think we all want to know, what two words would you use to describe Boss Hogg?

transcript.speaker: Catherine Bach
transcript.dialogue: Monkey gland, uh, sauce?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Uh, two words, please!

transcript.speaker: Catherine Bach
transcript.dialogue: So delicate and perfect.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: You could tell! And how did they treat you on that show? Would they give you a whole meal, or just one course?

transcript.speaker: Catherine Bach
transcript.dialogue: "The Dukes of Hazzard" gave me the entree...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: But no dessert? Hmmm, sounds kind of cheap. Now, your new TV series takes you to a new continent. Tell me, how is Africa different from the States?

transcript.speaker: Catherine Bach
transcript.dialogue: There's no Sigfried and Roy in, um, in South Africa.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: What! I didn't know that. Moltar! Get my investment advisor on the phone. Divest all interest in South Africa immediately! (low voice) Uh, those views were mine, and do not necessarily reflect the station or its owners. (normal voice) Quick, Catherine, cover for me! Tell a story about the black rhino!

transcript.speaker: Catherine Bach
transcript.dialogue: First of all, the black rhino does not breed in captivity.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Nor do I!

transcript.speaker: Catherine Bach
transcript.dialogue: They are now taking the black rhino and trying to impregnate the, the white rhino, the female white rhino... (switches getting thrown?)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Go on.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Would you please keep your mind on the music!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: I can't! It's mating season!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: So what's the big deal? Unless... Zorak! (chuckles) Is it your first time?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Don't be ridiculous! I've mated, uh, plenty of times!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Wait a minute, that can't be true!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: And why not?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: 'Cause your head's still attached to your body!

transcript.speaker: Catherine Bach
transcript.dialogue: (moving hands in front of mouse) Whhhoooosh!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (crude mantis head graphic appears on control room monitor) See, in the mantis marital act, the female typically eats the head and brain of the male. (pieces of head disappear one by one)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: You're kidding!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: You didn't know that?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: That's not what my mother told me!

transcript.speaker: Catherine Bach
transcript.dialogue: (laughs)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: It's not funny!

transcript.speaker: Catherine Bach
transcript.dialogue: (laughs)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Catherine, I'll have to ask you to please stop laughing.

transcript.speaker: Catherine Bach
transcript.dialogue: (laughs)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I'm serious!

transcript.speaker: Catherine Bach
transcript.dialogue: (laughs)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I warned you. (zaps her off monitor) Okay, Zorak, she's gone. And you know what I was thinking? If you want to go mate, I shouldn't stop you. It's every space creature's inalienable right to know love and be loved and have love and share love and know love and... did I say that one already?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: I'm not so sure I want to be loved anymore!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: What, are you afraid of commitment?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Hey, look, there's Matthew Sweet! (Matthew appears on monitor)

transcript.speaker: Matthew Sweet
transcript.dialogue: ... the teen tycoon of rock, from beyond the valley of the dolls.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Eh, tell me, Matt, uh, how.. do.. your pants, uh, stay up?

transcript.speaker: Matthew Sweet
transcript.dialogue: I just concentrate very hard, it's built into my brain. Like, I don't even need a belt for that.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Very good! Here's a riddle... What would you eat with a bio-dip?

transcript.speaker: Matthew Sweet
transcript.dialogue: A bio-chip.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: You're sharp! I bet you're pretty powerful, too!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (starts makes gibbering noises, which continue in background)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: You know, I can use my power bands to bring the Atlantic Ocean to a boiling point in five seconds! Can you point a finger and heat something up?

transcript.speaker: Matthew Sweet
transcript.dialogue: If you, if you mean like baking a potato or boiling an egg, I might be okay. (laughs)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I thought so. Keep working at it, you have the makings of a super-hero! Perhaps I might could give you some tips.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (still gibbering, then stops) I can't hold it! I must go to my home planet! I want lo-o-o-ve!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: But the consequences...

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (starts gibbering again)

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, go on...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Matthew, what do you think? Should Zorak go home to mate?

transcript.speaker: Matthew Sweet
transcript.dialogue: Uh, have a good time, all the time.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Even if it means certain death?

transcript.speaker: Matthew Sweet
transcript.dialogue: Why not?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: That settles it! I'm off, and I'm taking the Phantom Cruiser!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: All right, but in the event you lose your head, call a cab. Oh, and, uh, there's a Gino Vanelli tape in the glove compartment.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (boing!) (bounds off stage and into Phantom Cruiser & takes off, burning rubber sounds) Yee-hoo!
INTERRUPT FEED

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (belches, then notices camera is on; his face turns red) Heh heh, dear me! Uh, a thousand pardons, friends... Zorak's music normally covers that.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: It's all because you sneak bites from a pork chop sandwich during station breaks.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (with mouth full of food) I don't know what you're talking about!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: It's a disgusting habit!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Come on, lots of people are doing it! Matthew Sweet, you're a man of the world, have you ever had a big, sloppy pork chop sandwich?

transcript.speaker: Matthew Sweet
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, it wasn't too good, we had to cancel some shows. Needless to say, I haven't done it since then.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Aw, you're no help! (Eh, what was I talking about?) That's right, no music! Well, we can't have that, so I will provide it.

transcript.speaker: Matthew Sweet
transcript.dialogue: Oh, really?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: You bet! Steve Allen played the piano, Arthur Godfrey played the ukulele, and I, Space Ghost, play... the blues harp! Can't really do it unless someone's telling a sad story! Tell a sad story!

transcript.speaker: Matthew Sweet
transcript.dialogue: Uh, well, I... what happens is, I'll drink...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Perfect, keep going. (starts playing)

transcript.speaker: Matthew Sweet
transcript.dialogue: I get really thirsty on stage, y'know, and I don't feel it or anything, 'cause I just have a couple of beers, you know...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, yeah... (keeps playing)

transcript.speaker: Matthew Sweet
transcript.dialogue: ... but when they're empty, I keep going back and picking up an empty bottle, over and over again, it makes me really frustrated...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Sadder, make it sadder! (keeps playing)

transcript.speaker: Matthew Sweet
transcript.dialogue: ... so I got in the habit of knocking them off the back of the amplifier, 'cause they would never break.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Testify!

transcript.speaker: Matthew Sweet
transcript.dialogue: Uh...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Go on with your bad self!

transcript.speaker: Matthew Sweet
transcript.dialogue: Like, a beer bottle's pretty sturdy.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (in blues voice) A beer bottle's, pretty sturday!

transcript.speaker: Matthew Sweet
transcript.dialogue: But anyhow, uh, so I would knock them off the back, and one night, uh, I knocked one off, and I guess it must have exploded or something, 'cause I was playing the last song, and my hands felt all sticky, and I looked down, and there was blood everywhere.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (finishes playing) We should take this show on the road! Play the House of Blues!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Here's where he mentions Dan Ackroyd.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Hey, I know Dan Ackroyd! I know Dan Ackroyd! Matthew, can I ask you a favor?

transcript.speaker: Matthew Sweet
transcript.dialogue: Alright.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Would you mind holding your breath while I ask Moltar a non-show-related question?

transcript.speaker: Matthew Sweet
transcript.dialogue: (takes a deep breath and holds it)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Moltar, what's going on with Zorak?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: My readings show he's landed on his home planet, and is zeroing in on his target.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (talking to female mantis) If I said you had a beautiful exoskeleton, would you hold it against me?

transcript.speaker: Female Mantis 1
transcript.dialogue: (giggles)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Stru-u-uck o-u-t! You know, Moltar, I never realized how scrawny Zorak was compared to the others!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, his steady diet of evil has taken its toll. Ultimately the internal manifested self and the external...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Um, yeah. (I wish I had the slightest idea what Moltar was talking about.)

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Uh, Space Ghost?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: What?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: You should check on Matthew. I think we're about to lose him. (Matthew's face is purple on monitor, still holding his breath)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Silly me! (laughs) Matthew, you can stop now! (Matthew starts breathing again, his face returns to normal) You know, Matthew, just because somebody tells you to do something, doesn't mean you should always do it.

transcript.speaker: Matthew Sweet
transcript.dialogue: Really?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Do you think, in the future, you should try to be more careful?

transcript.speaker: Matthew Sweet
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, a little more careful.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Space Ghost, you better check this out. There's activity on Zorak's home planet. (monitor shows Zorak and second female mantis, a Marlo Thomas look-alike)

transcript.speaker: Female Mantis 2
transcript.dialogue: (blink!)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (blink!)

transcript.speaker: Female Mantis 2
transcript.dialogue: (blink! blink!)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (blink! blink!)

transcript.speaker: Female Mantis 2
transcript.dialogue: (blink! blink! blink!)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (blink! blink! blink! blink!)

transcript.speaker: Female Mantis 2
transcript.dialogue: (blink! blink! blink! blink! blink! blink!)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (blink! blink! blink! blink! blink! blink!)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Looks like Zorak's made a love connection! (romantic music swells)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Do you like walks in the rain?

transcript.speaker: Female Mantis 2
transcript.dialogue: Oh, yes!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: And Elizabeth Barrett Browning's sonnets from the Portuguese?

transcript.speaker: Female Mantis 2
transcript.dialogue: How did you know?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: I know things about you.

transcript.speaker: Female Mantis 2
transcript.dialogue: You're the most exciting mantis I've ever met!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: I want to spend the rest of my life with you!

transcript.speaker: Female Mantis 2
transcript.dialogue: And so you shall!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Zorak going to his home planet was a great idea! Love has transformed him. When he comes back, he'll be a new bug!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: I don't think he'll be coming back.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Why not?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: I explained it all earlier in the show. Don't you remember?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Of course I remember! (pause) I have to go to the little ghost's room. (flies off to room with console) (Note to myself: got to use my memory.) (rewinds through video tape of show, back to Moltar's original explanation)

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (on tape) ...the female typically eats the head and brain of the male... (rewinds) the male... (rewinds) the head...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (stops tape) Dear Lord! That's right! (flies back to desk) Sorry, Matthew, our time is up. There's a crisis, and you've got to understand, I'm a super-hero first, and a talk show host second!

transcript.speaker: Matthew Sweet
transcript.dialogue: We can be invisible together.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Nice try, but I was saving galaxies while you were still reading along with the lyrics of the Three Dog Night "Harmony" album. I think I can handle this one alone! Goodbye! (zaps Matthew off monitor) Moltar, it's time for action! We must get Zorak out of there!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Well, what can we do? Nature must run its course. Plus, he took the Phantom Cruiser.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: But, this means certain death for Zorak!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: I know. Uh, can I have his dressing room?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: How can you think of dressing rooms at a time like this? (choir music swells) A time of great sadness. Oh, Zorak, we hardly knew ye! Yes, you were pure evil, but I learned to see the good in that. I'll miss you, my little friend who used to try and kill me. But, rest assured, you will not be forgotten! I'll always remember that vile, near-poisonous gas you would emit when you were happy. And I'll never forget lunching with you in the commissary, watching you eat ten raw chickens and drink toner from the copy machine. You loved that toner. I know! We'll have a parade! (music changes to marching band music) We'll declare a national holiday on the Ghost Planet! With wonderful floats and big balloons, and we'll all drink fizzy lemonade, and eat Neapolitan ice cream! We'll celebrate the moments of your life, Zorak! You shall not have died in vain!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (walks across stage and returns to bandstand)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: A ghost!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Idiot!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Zorak? Is that really you?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Yes!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: He's back!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Darn! I wanted that Neapolitan ice cream.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: What happened on your home planet?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: I don't wanna talk about it.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: But you couldn't have mated. We can see your head's still attached to your body!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: I said, I don't want to talk about it!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: We're all co-workers here, there's nothing you couldn't open up and tell us! Couldn't close the deal, could you?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: That wasn't the problem!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Then what was? I mean, we saw you leave with that lady mantis.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: That lady mantis... wasn't really a lady.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Not really a lady? Huh? Then she must have been... Wait! You were digging on a dude?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: It's not what you think. Carl is part of a male mantis resistance movement that intercedes at the moment when the urge is the worst. He lured me back to his nest, where we ate barbecue and talked sports until the urge had passed. He... saved my life, and for that, I will always be grateful.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: What a remarkable story! I wonder who owns the movie rights.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Ted Turner.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Oh well, never mind. We're just glad to have you back!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: And, I'm glad to be back. You know why? Because now, I can continue to plot my revenge against you, Space Ghost, and make every moment of your life a living heck! (evil laugh)

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (laughs)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (laughs)

transcript.speaker: (Shots of other cartoon characters laughing
transcript.dialogue: Jonny Quest, Hadji, Bandit, Muttly, giant creature from "Herculoids")

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: It's not funny!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (laughs)
